translation.en: [Eleanor chuckles] So you’re a first-timer?
[Ted] Mm-hmm, you?
A veteran. Two earlier dinner parties and a cocktail reception.
translation.ko: - 당신은요? - 여러 번 왔죠 저녁 식사 두 번 칵테일파티 한 번

translation.en: -[Ted] And? -Difficult to describe. [sighs]
-It’s always memorable. -[Ted] Hmm.
Eleanor Price, I’m with Reuters.
-[Ted] Ted Parsons. -Oh! You should have said.
-[Ted] Hmm. -Congratulations.
-Yes, indeed. -[Eleanor chuckles]
Thank you, this is a very big night for you.
-No, thank you. -It is.
[chuckles] You must be very happy.
-Well, I’m very relieved. -Uh-huh.
-And I’m grateful. -Hmm.
-How did he do it? -I have no earthly idea.
translation.ko: 어떻게 해결한 것 같아요? 전혀 모릅니다

translation.en: -[Eleanor chuckles] -How do you know Mott?
Everybody in Georgetown knows Ulrich.
He’s made himself indispensable to us at the embassy.
No, indispensable’s not the right word.
Impossible to ignore.
[woman] Think Lawrence of Arabia with a Blackberry.
The last time I was here, I sat next to Scalia.
translation.ko: 지난번에 여기 왔을 때는 연방 대법원 판사를 만났죠

translation.en: He officiated at their wedding. Can you imagine?
-Have you met his wife? -I didn’t know he was married.
Oh, of course he’s married. This is her house.
translation.ko: 당연히 결혼했죠 이건 그의 아내 집이에요

translation.en: Where is Elsa?
Invitation came through DOD. They sent me.
-Never heard of this guy. What’s his deal? -Not sure.
translation.ko: 이름을 들어본 적이 없는데 뭐 하는 사람이죠? 확실치 않지만 기적을 일으키는 사람이에요

translation.en: Apparently, a bit of a miracle worker.
I’ve only met him a couple of times.
-Have you heard the tales from Iraq? -No.
He sent us reports from the region for over two years.
Not that we’d asked for them. Most incredible shit you’ve ever seen.
translation.ko: 우리가 요청한 것도 아니었어요 정말 놀라운 내용들이었죠

translation.en: [Ulrich] So, finally I was forced to say, "You’re mad."
"Take your ridiculous plan, stick it up your asses."
-[crowd laugh] -Diplomatically, of course.
They said, "Ulrich, you cannot say that to the head of German intelligence."
translation.ko: 그러더군요, '울리히, 독일 정보국 국장에게 그러면 안 돼요'

translation.en: And I said, "I think I just did."
-[crowd chuckle] -I mean, come on.
If you’re talking about, uh, planting a listening device
-in some hotel room somewhere… -[door opening]
…in the back of some underling’s car, well, all right.
But Madeleine Albright’s master bath?
Come on! Don’t be silly.
Uh, then, you know, I went home.
Slept on it. The next day they rang and made an offer--
translation.ko: 밤새 고민했어요 다음 날 저한테 전화해서는 제안을 했는데…

translation.en: -How do they say? That you can’t refuse. -[crowd chuckle]
[Eleanor] What happened?
[Ulrich] Well… maybe next time you’re at Madeleine Albright’s,
don’t have any significant conversations in her bathroom.
-[crowd chuckles] -[Ulrich] May I invite you?
[man] Thank you.
-Oh, pardon me. Sorry to startle you. -You-- you didn’t.
translation.ko: 실례할게요 놀라게 해서 미안해요 놀라지 않았어요

translation.en: She often takes a nap before dinner. I’ve just come to wake her.
translation.ko: 어머니가 저녁 식사 전에 잠깐씩 주무셔서 깨우러 왔어요

translation.en: Excuse me.
Of course, he could always hire a caterer, but he does everything himself.
translation.ko: 출장 요리를 부를 수도 있지만 항상 직접 요리해요

translation.en: [woman] Oh, I know.
I apologize for my late appearance. Hi.
-Ulrich promised he’d wake me earlier. -Is that Elsa?
-Yes. -[Ulrich] Well, I thought
you needed the rest, madam.
-Oh, you see how he babies me? -[crowd chuckle]
translation.ko: 날 아기 취급 하는 게 보이죠?

translation.en: You know how I hate to miss the cocktails.
translation.ko: 같이 칵테일 마시는 걸 좋아하는 거 알잖아요

translation.en: -[crowd chuckle] -[Ulrich] Well, we all forgive you
if you wish to make up for lost time.
Ah. Now, before anything else…
To Ulrich and his marvelous achievement.
No, no, no, no. It-- I was just one of many players
translation.ko: 아니야, 아니야 난 매우 복잡한 게임에 참가한

translation.en: in a very complicated game. It’s really--
-Oh, listen, I’m making the toast. -Oh. Sorry.
-[crowd chuckle] -And to a woman and her freedom.
And to all of you who are celebrating with us.
translation.ko: 그리고 함께 축하하고 있는 여러분 모두를 위해

translation.en: -Hear, hear. -[guests] Hear, hear.
-[man 2] Cheers.
It’s very warm. Now, we’re all hungry. Fetch the soup.
translation.ko: 아주 따뜻해 모두 배고프니까 수프를 줘

translation.en: Yes, it is true. One of our staffers was arrested in Iran.
translation.ko: 네, 사실이에요 우리 직원 한 명이 이란에서 체포됐죠

translation.en: She’s a lovely lady. Married. Daughter just started kindergarten.
translation.ko: 정말 좋은 여자분이고 결혼도 했어요 딸이 막 유치원에 들어갔죠

translation.en: Now, we don’t hear from her for a few days
and then the word comes back. They have grabbed her
translation.ko: 연락이 왔는데 그녀를 간첩 혐의로 체포했다는 거예요

translation.en: and they’re holding her on espionage charges.
She was a spy?
No. We’re a research shop. She’s a economist. It’s bullshit.
translation.ko: 우린 연구 기관이고 그녀는 경제학자였어요 어처구니없었죠, 하지만 국무부는 아무것도 안 했어요

translation.en: Nevertheless, the State Department, you wouldn’t touch it.
translation.ko: 어처구니없었죠, 하지만 국무부는 아무것도 안 했어요

translation.en: You’re too busy with this transition in Iraq.
[Ted] We couldn’t communicate with anybody over there.
We’re completely helpless, out of touch.
Meanwhile… [clears throat]
Thank you, Mott. Meanwhile, this poor woman
translation.ko: 고마워요, 모트 그 와중에 이 불쌍한 여자 직원은

translation.en: is rotting in a jail cell in Tehran.
And then a friend of mine, a former ambassador,
refers me to our illustrious host.
translation.ko: 이 자리를 마련해 준 저 유명한 분을 소개했죠

translation.en: Oh, for Christ’s sake, Ted!
I step away for a minute, you start embarrassing me.
Oh, no, Ulrich. Let him tell his story.
Well, we met and he said he’d take care of it.
N--nah, nah, nah. I-- I said I’d look into it.
-And? -And…
ten days later, she’s released. Now, he did that.
translation.ko: 10일 후에 그 여자 직원이 풀려났어요 모트가 해낸 거죠

translation.en: -Mott did that. -[woman] How?
[Ted] He still hasn’t told me.
You can’t expect a magician to give away his tricks.
-[Ted chuckles] -[man] Come on. -No, no, no, no. -[man] Mr. Mott…
No, no. Enough. Enough of that.
-[Ulrich] Please, sit. -[Elsa] What?
Well, I hope she’s feeling all right.
I-- I can’t, I-- I just can’t. I can’t listen to any more of this.
translation.ko: 못 해요 더는 듣고 있을 수 없어요

translation.en: -It’s the middle of the dinner. -I don’t care about the dinner.
translation.ko: 저녁 식사 중이잖아 식사는 안 중요해요

translation.en: I didn’t even know there was gonna be a dinner.
I came here to see you, Mother.
You told me you wanted to spend some time together.
We never get to do that anymore. And I get here and it’s all about him,
translation.ko: 더는 그러지 않으니까요 그래서 왔는데 저 사람 얘기만 하고

translation.en: his celebration, his idiotic stories.
-He’s done a great thing. -Yeah, right.
Let me know when he wins the Nobel Prize.
-I’ll meet you in Stockholm. -That’s childish.
After everything you’ve been through,
you still let him live in your house, spend your money--
translation.ko: 엄마 집에서 살게 하고 엄마 돈을 쓰게…

translation.en: -He's my husband. It’s our house. -Yeah, I know. I know.
translation.ko: 내 남편이야 이건 우리 두 사람 집이고 네, 알아요

translation.en: -[man] Mr. Mott… -[indistinct chatter]
-[sighs] You’re punishing me. -[Amanda] Punishing you?
Look, I’ll do whatever it takes, okay?
I will move back to DC. I would-- I would do that.
translation.ko: 워싱턴 D.C.로 이사 올게요 그럴 수 있어요

translation.en: I’ll teach here, okay? You could come to Boston.
translation.ko: 여기서 강의할게요 엄마가 보스턴으로 와도 되고요

translation.en: I will do anything to help you
translation.ko: 엄마가 원한다면 뭐든 해서 도울 테니

translation.en: if you will please, please stop doing this.
translation.ko: 엄마가 원한다면 뭐든 해서 도울 테니 이것만은 멈추세요

translation.en: You don’t understand. So go if you don’t want to be with us.
translation.ko: 넌 이해 못 해 우리와 함께 있기 싫으면 가라

translation.en: Can’t you do this in the morning?
Yes, I could. I’d just like to clear some of it now.
Yes, but then you’ll-- you'll be up until 2:00 a.m. and you’ll wake me when you come upstairs.
translation.ko: 그럼 2시가 될 테고 위층에 올라올 때, 내가 깰 거야

translation.en: I’m sorry that my clearing up after our party disturbs your rest.
translation.ko: 우리 파티가 끝나고, 치우는 일이 당신 휴식을 방해해서 미안해

It’s Amanda, isn’t it? She put you in this mood.
Why you invite that sour little bitch, I’ll never understand.
translation.ko: 그 못된 년을 왜 초대하는지 이해가 안 돼

translation.en: Don’t you talk about my daughter like that and don’t you dare smoke in my house.
translation.ko: 내 딸에 대해 그렇게 말하지 마 그리고 내 집에서 담배 피우지 마

translation.en: Nice beret, dude.
Hello?
She was fine. She ate well.
She seemed to enjoy herself.
When was the last time you spoke with her?
-Before I left the house last night. -[officer] When was this?
translation.ko: 제가 어젯밤에 집에서 나가기 전에요 그게 언제였죠?

translation.en: When she went to bed, I went for a walk sometime after midnight. [inhales deeply]
translation.ko: 아내가 자러 갔고 자정 이후에 산책하러 나갔어요

translation.en: I often do. She doesn’t like--
Didn’t like me to smoke in the house.

translation.en: [inhales deeply] And when I returned, I found her…

And that’s when you called 911?
Yeah.
I called immediately. I suppose I hoped…
-How old was your wife, Mr. Mott? -[breathes heavily]
[Amanda] She was 91.
-[door closing] -We must all be very brave now.
I know you left things on a somewhat sour note,
translation.ko: 파티에서 당신이 기분 나빴던 거 알아요

translation.en: -after the party. I’m terribly-- -None of that matters now.
translation.ko: 파티에서 당신이 기분 나빴던 거 알아요 - 정말로… - 이젠 아무 상관 없죠

translation.en: Do you want to discuss the arrangements?
You should know I want her to be buried in Arlington.
-Well, I want her alongside my father. -Yeah.
translation.ko: 저는 아버지 옆에 모시고 싶어요 네

translation.en: I think Arlington would mean a great deal to her.
translation.ko: 국립묘지가 엘사에게 큰 의미가 있을 거예요

translation.en: Why?
But, o--of course, I understand completely how you feel.
There are other issues.
[sighs] We have to discuss
the house, my mother’s papers, and her estate.
translation.ko: 이 집과 엄마의 문서들 부동산도 있죠

translation.en: It’s all taken care of.
I’ll be in touch very soon.
There will be time for tears and remembrance, I promise.
translation.ko: 눈물과 추모의 시간을 가질 거예요 약속해요

translation.en: But now there’s important work to be done.
translation.ko: 하지만 중요한 일을 먼저 해야 해요

translation.en: What work?
I must find and bring to justice

translation.en: the man who killed your mother and my wife.
[Ulrich] We are about to enter the inner sanctum, so to speak.
translation.ko: 지금 들어가는 곳은 말하자면 성스러운 밀실이에요

translation.en: The nerve center, the holy of holies. This is where information is gathered,
translation.ko: 중추 신경이고 가장 신성한 곳이죠 정보가 모이고

translation.en: options weighed, decisions made.
Decisions that affect lives, yours, mine.
translation.ko: 여러분과 저의 삶에 영향을 주는 결정들이죠

translation.en: Yes. [chuckles] Even the fate of nations.
No! I’m afraid I shall have to ask you to refrain from taking photographs.
translation.ko: 안 됩니다! 사진 촬영은 할 수 없습니다

translation.en: National security considerations.
No, no. It’s okay. Take all the photos you like.
-Where are you folks from? -[man 1] Akron.
[man 2] Cincinnati.
Look, they’re visiting their congressman’s office.
translation.ko: 자기 지역 하원의원 사무실을 방문한 거야

translation.en: I’d expect a 50-year-old intern to know that it’s constituent service, okay?
translation.ko: 그런 게 유권자 서비스라는 걸 50살 먹은 인턴은 알아야지

translation.en: I think inculcating an appropriate sense of the importance of the work
translation.ko: 제 생각에는 우리가 여기서 하는 일이 얼마나 중요한지 알려주는 게

translation.en: we’re doing here is very much of service to the constituents.
translation.ko: 얼마나 중요한지 알려주는 게 더 큰 유권자 서비스라고 생각했어요

translation.en: -How long you been in the US, Ulrich? -[Ulrich] Just a year.
But I’m on the accelerated track at American University.
In fact, I’ve just been accepted into the PhD program.
That’s great. I’m just wondering if maybe this job might not be the best fit.
translation.ko: 잘됐네, 자네한테 이 일이 안 맞는다고 생각했거든

translation.en: Gordon, it is so funny you should say that.
I couldn’t agree more.
I fear I'm miscast guiding tours or arranging tickets to the Smithsonian.
translation.ko: 방문객 안내나 박물관 표 구하는 일은 제 일이 아닌 것 같아요

translation.en: Diplomatic history and practice are my real passion.
translation.ko: 외교의 역사와 실행에 진정한 관심이 있죠

translation.en: Kissinger, Bismarck, Talleyrand.
What a genius, Talleyrand. Have you read him?
translation.ko: 탈레랑은 대단한 천재였어요 그의 책 읽어봤어요?

translation.en: Anyway, I was thinking I could put together some policy memos
translation.ko: 어쨌든, 제 생각에는 의원님을 위해 정책 보고서를 작성할 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: for the congressmen.
translation.ko: 의원님을 위해 정책 보고서를 작성할 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: Talk him through some of my more complex ideas over lunch, perhaps?
translation.ko: 의원님과 점심 먹으면서 제 생각을 전할 수 있지 않을까요?

translation.en: No! I mean here. Here might not be the best fit.
translation.ko: 아니! 난 여기를 말한 거였어 여기가 자네한테 안 맞는 것 같다고

translation.en: Are you firing me, Mr. Nichols?
I’m encouraging you to find a better place to develop your unique set of talents.
translation.ko: 당신의 독특한 재능을 발전시킬 더 나은 곳을 찾아보라는 거야

translation.en: -[man] Gordon? -[Gordon] Yeah.
[man] Can we go over the meeting schedule?
-Excuse me. -[phone ringing]
Nichols. Congressman Guyer’s office. I’m his chief of staff.
He’s going to have a stroke if I’m not at his table when the speeches start.
translation.ko: 연설 시작할 때까지 제가 안 가면 쓰러지실 거예요

translation.en: -Okay. -Thanks.
[Elsa] When I spoke to him about the event,
translation.ko: 그 사건에 관해 말했을 때 날 아주 놀라게 했어, 왜냐하면…

translation.en: he completely surprised me because…
translation.ko: 그 사건에 관해 말했을 때 날 아주 놀라게 했어, 왜냐하면… "엘사 브레트 기자"

translation.en: -[Ulrich] Pardon me. -[Elsa] …attending… What?
Oh. Thank you.
You must be Elsa Breht, the journalist?
-Yes. -Oh, my-- I’m Ulrich Mott. It’s an honor.
Your work is brilliant. I-- I read the Handelsblatt religiously.
-Oh, really? Thank you very much. -I’m working on the Hill
translation.ko: 정말요? 감사합니다 국회에서 일하면서 박사 과정에 다니고 있어요

translation.en: while finishing a doctorate in international relations.
translation.ko: 국회에서 일하면서 박사 과정에 다니고 있어요 국제 관계 전공이고요

translation.en: Perhaps we could have lunch sometime?
translation.ko: 언제 점심을 함께 할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: I believe there is a great deal I could learn from you.
translation.ko: 당신께 많은 걸 배울 수 있을 겁니다

translation.en: -Oh, well. Thank you. -Thank you.
Oh, pardon me.
[Elsa] Here’s the car.
Thank you.
When may I see you again?
Well… [chuckles]
-Mr. Mott, you are aware that I’m married. -Yes. So?
translation.ko: 모트 씨, 제가 결혼했다는 걸 아시잖아요 네, 그런데요?

translation.en: So, um, th-- thank you for a very enjoyable lunch
and good luck to you.
You let me know if anything changes.
-[chuckles] -[chuckles] What?
No, I-- I don’t know. Nothing.
You’re very amusing. [chuckles]
[Katherine] She hasn’t answered any invitations.
I used to see her every week at the Symphony…
but she stopped going.
-Hi, Mother. -Who’s here? I heard voices.
translation.ko: 안녕, 엄마 누가 왔어? 목소리가 들리던데

translation.en: -Katherine. -[Elsa] [groans] The rescue party.
She hadn’t heard from you in weeks, she said.
translation.ko: 몇 주 동안 연락이 안 됐대요

translation.en: You shouldn’t have brought her here.
Well, what am I supposed to do? Just stand by
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 해야 해요? 엄마가 무기력해지는 걸 그냥 지켜봐요?

translation.en: -and watch you slide into apathy here? -I’m not apathetic. Don’t be ridiculous.
translation.ko: 엄마가 무기력해지는 걸 그냥 지켜봐요? 무기력하지 않아 말도 안 돼

translation.en: I just don’t wish to be treated like an infant.
translation.ko: 아이 취급을 받고 싶지 않은 것뿐이야

translation.en: Nobody’s treating you like an infant. We only--
translation.ko: 아이 취급 안 해요 우린 그저…

translation.en: [Katherine] Hello, darling.
Now, we’re all gonna get our nails done.
translation.ko: 우린 모두 네일 숍에 갈 거야

translation.en: And then Brzezinski’s giving a talk at the National Press Club at 3:00,
which is right up your alley, and then dinner at La Chaumière.
translation.ko: 그건 네가 관심 있을 테고 '라 쇼미에르'에서 저녁 먹을 거야

translation.en: No arguments, darling. The reservation’s already made.
[Amanda] Please, Mom?
[man on TV] Now there you have it, there you have it!
-A New Year and a new millennium. -[phone ringing]
[man on TV] Finally, a day that many thought would spell the end of the world…
translation.ko: 마침내, 세상의 종지부를 찍을 거라던 그날이…

translation.en: Yes?
[Ulrich over phone] Truly an historic day.
Hmm? What?
[Ulrich over phone] Well, surely, you’re watching.
-[Elsa] Who’s this? -[Ulrich over phone] Ulrich Mott.
I took you for schnitzel. Oh, get to the point, Ulrich.
Mozart, Schumann, Berlin Philharmonic at the Kennedy Center Wednesday night.
translation.ko: 모차르트와 슈만을 베를린 필하모닉이 연주해요 수요일 저녁에 케네디 센터에서요

translation.en: It’s completely sold out, but I obtained two tickets.
-Don’t ask me how. I won’t tell you. -[chuckles]
translation.ko: 비결은 묻지 마세요 말 안 해 줄 거예요

translation.en: Call me in an hour.
[man on TV] It is a new millennium. The future is now here…
[man] Your mother never ceases to amaze.
-I hope I look half as good at her age. -Me too. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 나도 저 나이 됐을 때 반만 따라 해도 좋을 텐데 - 나도 그래 - 더 드릴까요?

translation.en: -May I? -[indistinct chatter]
Thank you.
And suddenly, the ascendant queen of Georgetown society.
She’s been holding a party a week, it seems.
Watch out, Sally Quinn!
-What’s her secret? -If you find out, let me know.
translation.ko: 비결이 뭐야? 뭔가 찾아내면 나한테도 알려줘

translation.en: [man] Oh, your father would be so glad to see it.
[Elsa] Darling, there’s something I need to discuss with you.
Now, you remember the time
translation.ko: 나한테 동반자가 필요하다고 네가 말했던 걸

translation.en: when you said you felt that I needed some companionship
translation.ko: 나한테 동반자가 필요하다고 네가 말했던 걸 기억할 거야

translation.en: and I was too dismissive at the time and I apologize because you were right.
translation.ko: 그때는 말도 안 된다고 생각했는데 사과할게 네 말이 맞았어

translation.en: Well. Uh… [chuckles]
Well, I have something I need to tell you too.
I got the position. At Harvard.
Oh, that’s wonderful.
Full professorship and tenure. They just sent the formal offer.
translation.ko: 정년이 보장된 교수직인데 공식 제안을 막 받았어요

translation.en: -Tremendous! That’s marvelous! -Yes!
Oh, but… well, they don’t know how lucky they are.
-And it’s all arranged? -Well, I have to--
-No, no, no, no. No, you take it. -I wanted to discuss it with you.
translation.ko: - 안 돼, 받아들여 - 엄마랑 상의하고 싶어요

translation.en: Shh, you take it. That’s all there is to it.
-Well-- -Oh, that’s marvelous.
And maybe you’ll meet someone there, darling.
[chuckles] Yes, I’m not particularly focused
translation.ko: 지금은 그 문제에 대해 신경 안 써요

translation.en: -on that right now. -No, I know things have been -very disappointing for you in that arena. -[Amanda chuckles]
translation.ko: 그 문제는 언제나 널 힘들게 했지

translation.en: Mom, can we not?
Look, I-- I thought maybe you’d consider going with me.
translation.ko: 엄마가 저랑 같이 가면 좋을 것 같아요

translation.en: Now I know how attached you are to Georgetown,
but it would be so much easier to help you out there.
translation.ko: 그래야 훨씬 쉽게 엄마를 도울 수 있겠죠

translation.en: Oh, darling. [chuckles] I don’t need help.
-No. But I thought you just said you wa-- -I have everything I need here.
translation.ko: 하지만 방금 얘기한 것도… 나한테 필요한 건 여기에 다 있어

translation.en: -[glass clinking] -What?
-Come on. -[Ulrich] Good afternoon, my friends.
I wish to make an announcement.
There is an ulterior motive for our little party today.
W--we didn’t want to make a big thing of it,
but we also wanted to share our joy with you.
So please raise your glasses with me
as I celebrate my great good fortune in becoming engaged to marry
translation.ko: 저에게 찾아온 약혼이라는 엄청난 행운을 축하해 주세요

translation.en: the extraordinary, the dazzling, Mrs. Elsa Breht.
-[man] Hear, hear! -[woman] Cheers!
[Amanda] How long have you known him?
Lower your voice.
And I don’t appreciate being spoken to
translation.ko: 수녀원 학교에 다니는 십 대 숫처녀한테

translation.en: like a virgin teenager from some convent school.
You know, he looks like he could be my brother.
It’s not like you don’t have any choice. You must have other suitors.
translation.ko: 선택의 여지가 없는 것도 아니잖아요 다른 구혼자도 있을 테고요

translation.en: They’re old and boring. Mott is young and interesting.
translation.ko: 다들 늙었고, 지루하지만 모트는 젊고, 재미있어

translation.en: I think he has enormous potential.
Okay.
Can we just stop, please? Playing these games. All right?
translation.ko: 제발 그만둘 수 없어요? 이런 게임은?

translation.en: This is me.
All right? Your only daughter, Amanda.
-Do you know anything about him? -Amanda, I don’t need your approval.
translation.ko: 그에 관해 알아요? 어맨다, 네 승인은 필요 없어

translation.en: I managed to survive the war.
I managed to come to this country, and learn English,
and raise a baby, and have a career.
So I think I can manage to marry… [chuckles]
translation.ko: 그래서 내 생각엔 잘해낼 수 있을 것 같아

translation.en: …a very fascinating and devoted and yes, somewhat younger man.
translation.ko: 매우 멋지고, 헌신적이고 어린 남자와 결혼하는 것도

translation.en: [exhales sharply] Oh, thank you. Thank you, Grant.
I just want him out of my house. I want him out of there now.
translation.ko: 그가 내 집에서 나가길 원해요 지금 당장요

translation.en: -Miss Breht, let me explain. -Detective, I teach constitutional law.
translation.ko: 브레트 씨 설명해 드릴게요 형사님, 전 헌법을 가르쳐요

translation.en: So please just remove the layer of condescension from your voice.
Explain to me why you’ve left a probable suspect alone,
at liberty, in an active crime scene?
This is not a criminal investigation, ma’am.
And as of now, all we have is a deceased 90-year-old woman
and a grieving spouse,
who we intend to interview first thing tomorrow morning.
translation.ko: 그가 내일 아침에 조사를 받겠다고 했고요

translation.en: And what about the ME? Have they established the cause of death?
translation.ko: 검시는 어떻게 됐죠? 사망 원인이 밝혀졌나요?

translation.en: Your mother had a head injury, likely due to falling on the stairs.
translation.ko: 머리의 상처는 계단에서 넘어져서 생긴 듯합니다

translation.en: -You don’t know that. -No, we don’t.
Which is why we’ll be waiting for a full autopsy, ma’am.
Shouldn’t take any more than a couple of days.
Mr. Mott, I want to remind you again, you may have an attorney present.
translation.ko: 모트 씨, 다시 말씀드리지만 변호사가 필요할 수 있습니다

translation.en: I’m fully aware of that and I don’t require any attorney.
Good. I want to go over what happened
translation.ko: 좋습니다 죽은 아내를 발견한 다음에 어떻게 했는지 다시 얘기해 보죠

translation.en: after you first discovered your wife’s body.
translation.ko: 죽은 아내를 발견한 다음에 어떻게 했는지 다시 얘기해 보죠

translation.en: [inhales deeply] I was coming home, expecting her to be asleep in her room.
translation.ko: 집에 돌아왔고 아내가 자고 있을 거로 생각했어요

translation.en: I didn’t expect to see her at all until the morning.
translation.ko: 아침까지 아내를 못 볼 줄 알았죠

translation.en: So, of course,
I was deeply in shock when I saw her there.
-You had separate rooms? -Yeah.
translation.ko: 방을 따로 쓰셨나요? - 네 - 이유가 뭐죠?

translation.en: -Why is that? -She was 91 years old, Detective.
Have you ever had conjugal relations with a woman in her early 90s?
translation.ko: 90대 초반의 여자와 부부 관계를 해본 적 있으세요?

translation.en: -No. -Neither have I.
Did you touch your wife’s body at any point after you discovered her?
translation.ko: 쓰러진 아내를 발견하고 사체에 손을 댔나요?

translation.en: I may-- Yes, I may have touched her briefly
to-- to check for a pulse or something.
[sighs] May I say something at this point?
-Please. -As I told you before,
translation.ko: - 한마디 해도 되겠습니까? - 네 이미 얘기했듯이 아내가 잠자리에 들고

translation.en: I was out for a portion of the evening after my wife went to bed.
translation.ko: 이미 얘기했듯이 아내가 잠자리에 들고 저는 밖에 나갔어요

translation.en: I was away from the house for several hours.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 동안 집 밖에 있었던 거죠

translation.en: -Where did you go? -For a walk.
For several hours?
I have very little time for exercise during the day
and after a heavy meal, I find it’s a necessity.
translation.ko: 식사를 많이 하면 그게 꼭 필요합니다

translation.en: The point, gentlemen, is this.
It seems very likely to me that it was during this period between…
translation.ko: 제 생각에는 제가 밖에 나갔던 그 시간 대략 11시에서 새벽 2시 사이에

translation.en: uh, approximately 11:00 and two o'clock in the morning
that someone broke in and murdered my wife.
Mr. Mott, there was no evidence of any break-in.
translation.ko: 모트 씨, 누군가가 집 안에 침입했다는 증거는 없습니다

translation.en: No, there wouldn’t be, would there?
translation.ko: - 당연히 없지 않겠어요? - 이해가 안 되네요

translation.en: -I don’t understand. -No, you clearly don’t.
translation.ko: - 당연히 없지 않겠어요? - 이해가 안 되네요 그렇겠죠, 이게 무슨 일인지 전혀 모르니까요

translation.en: You don’t understand what you’re dealing with at all.
translation.ko: 그렇겠죠, 이게 무슨 일인지 전혀 모르니까요

translation.en: -What do you mean, Mr. Mott? -[Ulrich] I mean…
translation.ko: - 그게 무슨 말이죠, 모트 씨? - 제 말은…

translation.en: Frankly, I can’t believe I have to spell this out for you.
translation.ko: 솔직히, 이런 얘기까지 해야 하는 게 믿기지 않네요

translation.en: [sighs] That the sort of people capable of committing this crime
translation.ko: 이런 범죄를 저지를 수 있는 사람들이

translation.en: would be far too sophisticated to leave convenient clues
translation.ko: 워싱턴 D.C. 경찰을 위해 단서를 남길 만큼

translation.en: for the likes of the DC police to stumble over.
Mr. Mott, do you know what this is?
-It is a criminal complaint. -[Grant] That’s right.
A complaint your wife filed against you for assault.
Is there anything you’d like to tell us about this?
This refers to an incident that occurred in New York City some time ago.
translation.ko: 얼마 전, 뉴욕시에서 있었던 사건 때문이에요

translation.en: That there was an argument between my wife and I.
That, while deeply painful and embarrassing,
it was not atypical of the sorts of dispute
that arise between passionate and long-married people.
translation.ko: 부부 사이에서 생길 만한 문제는 아니었어요

translation.en: That it precipitated a break in our marriage,
that was mended to our great mutual happiness
after two very difficult years apart.
Well…
given this history and given the fact there was no evidence of any intruder…
translation.ko: 과거 부부 사이의 문제와 침입 흔적이 없다는 점을 고려해

translation.en: We’re declaring this a homicide investigation.
Ah. I see.
And am I under arrest?
Not at the present time.
However, we have obtained a warrant ordering your house sealed
translation.ko: 하지만 당신 집을 봉쇄하라는 영장을 받았고

translation.en: -pending further forensic investigation. -[Koteras] You can’t go back there.
translation.ko: 추가적인 범죄 과학 수사를 진행할 거예요 집에 가면 안 됩니다

translation.en: [Grant] And we’re instructing you not to leave the DC area.
It’s Ulrich Mott. Can you meet? It’s urgent.
translation.ko: 울리히 모트예요 만날 수 있어요? 급해요

translation.en: [David] Mr. Mott.
[Ulrich] Thank you so much for meeting me.
-[David] Of course. -[Ulrich] Yeah, but let’s walk, shall we?
[David] We heard about Elsa on the news.
Terrible shock. I’m so sorry for your loss.
[Ulrich] It’s a very difficult time and I fear it’s only going to get worse.
translation.ko: 너무 힘든 시기인데 더 나빠질 것 같아요

translation.en: -[siren wailing] -[David] What do you mean?
-I-- I hope only a few days, but, um… -[knock on door]
The coroner’s report’s due about 11:00. I should know more then.
translation.ko: 검시 보고서가 11시에 나오면 더 많을 걸 알게 될 거야

translation.en: [Amanda] Oh, thank you.
[man] This came for you at the front desk.
-Yeah, thanks. -[man] Okay.
Yeah, believe me, I don’t wanna stay in DC another moment longer than I have to.
translation.ko: 나도 워싱턴 D.C.에 한시라도 더 있고 싶지 않아

translation.en: Thanks. I really appreciate it. Okay.
She left him 250,000 dollars. Plus, an additional 50
translation.ko: 그에게 25만 달러를 남겼고 유동 자산이 60만 달러가 넘으면 5만 달러가 추가돼요

translation.en: if her liquid assets exceed 600,000 dollars.
translation.ko: 유동 자산이 60만 달러가 넘으면 5만 달러가 추가돼요

translation.en: Liquid assets. I assume that means the house,
translation.ko: 유동 자산이라면 집을 말하는 것 같아요

translation.en: which has got to be worth, what? Close to a million.
-Probably more. -And he gets that too?
translation.ko: 그 이상일지 몰라요 그것도 받게 돼요?

translation.en: Yes.
[chuckles] No problem, Detective. No, no, no. We appreciate it.
I see.
No. I’ll tell her right now.
-All right. Thank you very much. -[phone beeps]
The ME has determined Elsa suffered injuries
consistent with blunt force trauma.
They’re opening a homicide investigation.
-Where is he? -Ma’am? I'm sorry--
That son of a bitch. He killed her.
-Okay, ma’am, if you could just-- -Don’t touch me!
-[officer] Hang on. Ma’am, calm down. -Don’t tell me to calm down.
translation.ko: 잠깐만요, 부인, 진정하세요 진정하라고 하지 마세요

translation.en: [officer] There’s no one here right now. Do you have any idea where Mott might be?
translation.ko: 여기엔 아무도 없습니다 모트의 행방을 아십니까?

translation.en: How should I know? He might have fled the country by now.
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 알아요? 지금쯤 이 나라를 떠났겠죠

translation.en: You’ve got to put a hold on his passport.
[officer] Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on.
-Are you Ulrich Mott? -Yes.
[officer] You have the right to remain silent.
Anything you say can and will be used against you
translation.ko: 당신의 진술은 법정에서 불리하게 이용될 수 있습니다

translation.en: in a court of law. You have the right to an attorney.
translation.ko: 당신의 진술은 법정에서 불리하게 이용될 수 있습니다 변호사를 선임할 권리가 있고

translation.en: If you cannot afford an attorney, one will be provided.
translation.ko: 그럴 능력이 없으면 국가가 제공할 것입니다

translation.en: The mail just came. And here’s my latest acquisition.
translation.ko: 금방 온 우편물이고 이건 최신 구매품이야

translation.en: -Ho, ho, ho! Oh, Bravo! -[Ulrich chuckles]
Most ingenious thing I’ve ever seen.
-[woman] Oh. -[Elsa] Goodbye, dear.
So we’ll see you Sunday at the Scowcroft’s?
Go fetch the car.
He’s very charming.
Isn’t he?
Have I done something wrong?
No.
It’s all perfect.
Thank you.
You are the perfect butler.
Is that all you want to be?
You know it isn’t.
So what are you waiting for?
-An opportunity. I’m trying. -[Elsa] Are you?
Am I the opportunity?
You’re my wife.
Vladimir Petrovsky.
He’s a very dear old friend.
A diplomat in the Soviet era
and now he works in the United Nations in Geneva.
We make our opportunities.
[Ulrich] Mr. Petrovsky?
I believe we have a mutual friend, Elsa Breht.
translation.ko: 우리 둘 다 아는 친구가 있어요 엘사 브레트죠

translation.en: Uh-- um. No. She sends her best.
Certainly, I-- I will tell her.
The reason for my call… y--you see, um…
I-- I was just thinking…
I was wondering…
I-- I recently left my position on the Hill…
I was leading study groups for members of Congress
in foreign relations,
uh-- to form my own company, my… consulting firm.
M--my interpersonal services and consulting firm.
Um, we are now a second year of operation
a--and we have a number of clients, like yourself,
who are looking for an informal kind of representative in Washington
translation.ko: 필요할 때마다 워싱턴에서 일을 맡아 줄

translation.en: on an ad hoc basis. Yeah.
Well, if-- if there’s a conference, a meeting,
maybe even a party that you might have an interest in
but are unable to be in attendance
and we are your Washington eyes and ears, so to say.
translation.ko: 대신 워싱턴의 눈과 귀가 돼 드리는 거죠 말하자면요

translation.en: Yes? [chuckles] Indeed.
It’s remarkable that no one’s ever thought of it before, but…
translation.ko: 누구도 그런 생각을 못 했다는 게 놀라운 일이지만…

translation.en: Ulrich Mott and Associates. Let me give you my private number.
There’s no need for you to go through my secretary.
Can I just interrupt the conversation?
-[Elsa] Yes, of course. -[Ulrich] Okay.
-[dramatic music playing] -On the left.
[Ulrich] Pardon me. Ulrich Mott,
representing Vladimir Petrovsky, the UN in Geneva.
translation.ko: 제네바에 있는 유엔의 페트로프스키 씨 대신 왔습니다

translation.en: Mr. Petrovsky sends his regrets at not being able to attend today.
translation.ko: 페트로프스키 씨가 참석하지 못해 죄송하다는 말씀을 전하셨습니다

translation.en: With your kind permission, I will read his remarks
translation.ko: 여러분이 허락하신다면 그분의 연설을 대신 읽고

translation.en: and after, answer any questions you may have.
Y--you should speak to my husband about that.
That’s exactly what Mott and Associates was set up to handle.
translation.ko: 그런 문제를 해결하기 위해 '모트 컨설팅'을 세웠죠

translation.en: May, uh… leave my card with you? Please, feel free…
[Elsa] Ulrich Mott and Associates. No, I don’t like it.
International… Solutions Symposium, you know?
-Oh, keep it short. Keep it short. -Global Solution Group?
translation.ko: 짧아야 해, 짧게 '글로벌 문제 해결 그룹'?

translation.en: -Prominent Persons Group? -No. No, no, no… Near-- near, um…
translation.ko: '뛰어난 인재 그룹'? 아니야 아니, 아니야… 가까운데

translation.en: T… Eminent Persons Group. Eminent Persons Group.
So she has-- Oh, there she is.
Oh, he is so sweet! He’s very intelligent.
Yes. Well, I assume so.
If only one can have grandchildren. I don’t have…
translation.ko: 손주를 가질 수 있다면 난 그럴 수…

translation.en: He’s with the Defense Threat Reduction Agency.
Excellent contact. Could be very valuable to us.
Good.
[judge] All right. This is a preliminary detention hearing
in the case of United States VS Ulrich Gero Mott…
[clears throat] Your Honor, there are a few issues
that Mr. Mott would like to raise before the court.
-What sort of issues? -Mr. Mott hasn’t told me in detail.
translation.ko: 어떤 문제인가요? 저한테 상세히 얘기하지 않았습니다

translation.en: He made it clear he’d like to be heard on this as opposed to me, so…
All right.
Thank you, Your Honor, and good morning.
-Good morning. -[Ulrich] I wish to lodge
the following complaints.
The United States is in open violation of my rights under the Geneva Convention.
translation.ko: 미국 정부가 제네바 협약에 따른 제 권리를 침해하고 있다는 겁니다

translation.en: I am, and remain, a serving officer in a foreign army
translation.ko: 저는 외국 군대에 복무하고 있기 때문에

translation.en: and as such am entitled to my uniform and insignia,
as well as to be addressed by my full rank,
Brigadier General Ulrich Mott.
-[gentle music playing] -I’m sorry, did you say brigadier general?
That is correct.
[judge] In the United States Army?
No. The Iraqi Special Forces.
Well, as regards the legal issues you raise,
I’ll ask the government to look into them and respond.
All right?
-Are we ready to proceed? -[Volker] Yes, Your Honor.
Could you get us some documentation on that?
translation.ko: 그것에 관한 문서를 줄 수 있나요?

translation.en: The court’s gonna want to see it.
-Proof of my rank, you mean? -[Durant] Yeah.
Well, of course. That goes without saying. I can arrange it immediately.
translation.ko: 그야 물론이죠 즉시 준비할 수 있습니다

translation.en: Mr. Mott, it would have been helpful
if you had told us ahead of time about your military…
affiliation, or whatever you choose to call it.

translation.ko: 그만해 난 정말 괜찮아 혹시 몰라서 부엌 냉동고에 캐서롤을 넣어뒀어요

translation.en: in the kitchen in the freezer, just in case.
translation.ko: 혹시 몰라서 부엌 냉동고에 캐서롤을 넣어뒀어요

translation.en: -[Elsa] Oh, you know I despise casseroles. -[Amanda chuckles]
[Elsa] Oh, dear. [whimpers] Oh, dear.
-[sobs] -What?
He calls me sometimes.
-What? -He sounds so far away.
-But also like he’s next door. -Don’t take his calls. Please.
translation.ko: 하지만 옆집에 있는 것 같기도 하고 그 사람 전화 받지 말아요

translation.en: You are so much better off. You know that. Wherever the hell he is.
translation.ko: 엄마는 혼자가 훨씬 나아요 알잖아요, 그가 어디에 있든지요

translation.en: He’s in Iraq.
Iraq?
He’s doing extraordinary things.
I keep replaying that day in New York in my head over and over
translation.ko: 머릿속으로 뉴욕에서의 그날을 계속 생각하고 있어

translation.en: and h--how you stood me, I can’t imagine.
translation.ko: 당신이 날 어떻게 참아준 건지 상상이 안 돼

translation.en: [Elsa over phone] It’s in the past.
And I was not always so easy.
When I’m finished here, is there a ch-- No, no. I shouldn’t.
translation.ko: 여기 일이 끝나면 기회가… 아니야, 그럴 수 없어

translation.en: No, no. Go on, go on.
Just knowing there is a possibility
would be enough to sustain me through the trials ahead.
translation.ko: 앞으로의 시련을 잘 견딜 수 있을 것 같아

translation.en: Is there a chance that I could come home?
To Georgetown? To you?
[Elsa over phone] Oh, no. No, no, no, maybe.
I’ve experienced today one of the most sublime,
the most exquisite moments of my life.
I’ve been on watch at Mookie’s camp all night
and it gets very cold in the desert at night.
The chill creeps into your bones and the doubt.
And I was wondering what it was all for.
Whether there was any real purpose for my being here at all.
translation.ko: 내가 여기에 있는 것에 진정한 의미가 있는 것인지

translation.en: And then I heard the music.
Mookie had found, God knows how,
a recording of a Prussian military march and played it over the camp loudspeaker.
translation.ko: 프로이센 군대 행진곡 음반을 캠프의 큰 스피커로 틀었어

translation.en: And I have no idea how he knew that I loved that music from childhood,
translation.ko: 내가 어릴 때부터 그 음악을 좋아한 걸 어떻게 알았는지

translation.en: let alone how he found a recording.
Then the men formed up…
and paid a tribute to me.
And he was telling me… I belonged.
That my efforts here have not been wasted.
That I have made a difference after all.
And that, perhaps, now…
[Ulrich over phone] …it’s time to come home.
Come in.
[Ulrich] Sorry. I was just picking up the mail. One second.
Oh, okay. That’s better.
[paramedic] Yeah. Right over there.
That way. Inside there.
I said that dozens, possibly hundreds of times.
I’m not guilty of the murder of my wife Elsa Breht.
translation.ko: 저는 제 아내, 엘사 브레트를 죽이지 않았어요

translation.en: [judge] It was my understanding
that you were no longer representing Mr. Mott.
translation.ko: 당신은 이제 모트 씨를 변호하지 않잖아요

translation.en: Where is the defendant?
[Volker] Your Honor,
translation.ko: 판사님, 모트 씨는 몇 주 동안

translation.en: uh, Mr. Mott has refused to communicate with either me or my colleague
translation.ko: 판사님, 모트 씨는 몇 주 동안 저나 제 동료와의 연락을 거부하고 있습니다

translation.en: for several weeks now, so we’re unable to proceed.
translation.ko: 저나 제 동료와의 연락을 거부하고 있습니다 그래서 계속 진행할 수 없습니다

translation.en: What’s going on, Counselor?
Uh, Mr. Mott is currently engaged in a hunger strike.
translation.ko: 모트 씨는 현재 단식 투쟁을 하고 있습니다

translation.en: He’s in a weakened condition and has since been moved to a hospital.
W--we’re therefore submitting a motion to have him declared unfit for trial.
Well, the court will have to make a determination about that.
[Volker] Of course.
-Thank you. -[woman] I’m so sorry.
-Thank you. Thank you very much. -[woman] Okay.
Are you really gonna help him wiggle out of this?
We have to wait for the evaluation.
-If he’s found mentally unfit-- -He’s faking. It’s obvious.
translation.ko: 정신적으로 온전하지 않다면… 속이고 있어요 명백하죠

translation.en: -Like he faked everything. -You don’t know that.
translation.ko: - 모든 걸 속였던 것처럼요 - 그건 모르시잖아요

translation.en: I don’t know that.
The more I find out about this guy, the less I understand.
translation.ko: 조사를 하면 할수록 더 알 수가 없어요

translation.en: You know, every word he says is a fucking lie.
translation.ko: 그가 하는 모든 말은 다 거짓말이에요

translation.en: Maybe.
But what about Iraq?
How the hell did he do what he did there?
translation.ko: 거기서 어떻게 그런 일을 할 수 있었죠?

translation.en: Can you explain that?
I can’t.
Can’t you do this in the morning?
Yes, I could. I’d just like to clear some of it now.
Yes, but then you’ll-- you'll be up until 2:00 a.m.,
and you’ll wake me when you come upstairs.
translation.ko: 위층에 올라올 때 내가 깰 거야

translation.en: I’m sorry that my clearing up after our party disturbs your rest.
translation.ko: 우리 파티가 끝나고, 치우는 일이 당신 휴식을 방해해서 미안해

translation.en: [Elsa] Our party? As if anyone could get a word in.
It’s Amanda, isn’t it? She put you in this mood.
Why you invite that sour little bitch, I’ll never--
translation.ko: 그 못된 년을 왜 초대하는지 이해가…

translation.en: Don’t you talk about my daughter like that.
translation.ko: 내 딸에 대해 그렇게 말하지 마

translation.en: And don’t you dare smoke that in my house.
translation.ko: 그리고 내 집에서 담배 피우지 마

translation.en: Yeah. Excellent. Um, can we talk?
N-not on the telephone. It’s not prudent. But it has to be in person.
translation.ko: 전화로는 안 돼요 신중해야죠, 만나야 해요

translation.en: -Who is that? Who are you talking to? -Quiet!
Um… well, as soon as you can.
-I-- I can meet you now. -No, you can’t.
translation.ko: - 지금 만날 수 있어요 - 아니, 안 돼

translation.en: That would-- Shut your fucking face!
Can’t I have a second’s peace?
Why don’t you crawl away to your bed? Go! Go to bed!
translation.ko: 어서 침대로 기어가 어서! 자러 가

translation.en: Excuse me. The usual place? Yeah. Excellent, excellent.
translation.ko: 실례했어요 평소에 만나던 곳에서요? 네, 좋아요

translation.en: What?
Who was that?
That is on a need-to-know basis and you do not need to know.
translation.ko: 지정인 외 접근 금지야 알 필요 없어

translation.en: You’re late.
Is it Halloween already?
-Should’ve worn my cowboy hat. -Very amusing.
translation.ko: 카우보이모자를 쓰고 왔어야 했는데 아주 재밌어

translation.en: -Have a drink. I’m having another myself. -How’s the old lady?
translation.ko: 한잔해 나도 한 잔 더 할 거야 노인네는 어때요?

translation.en: If you’re still with her, and, uh, if she’s still with us.
translation.ko: 아직도 같이 살고 있다면… 우리랑 같이 있다면요

translation.en: Elsa’s quite well, thank you. And yes, things are wonderful between us.
translation.ko: 엘사는 아주 건강해 고마워 우리 사이도 아주 좋아

translation.en: She’s a remarkable woman.
Great.
I wouldn’t be where I am now if not for Elsa.
translation.ko: 엘사가 아니었다면 이 자리에 없었을 거야

translation.en: I’m well aware of what I owe her.
translation.ko: 그녀에게 뭘 빚졌는지 잘 알고 있지

translation.en: That is not to say it isn’t also plain to me
the extent to which I’ve outgrown her.
translation.ko: 계속 매달려 있겠다고 말하는 건 아니야

translation.en: It’s not her fault, of course. It’s just the path life takes.
translation.ko: 물론, 그녀 잘못이 아니지 단지 삶의 경로야

translation.en: She’s lent me the wings with which I now take flight.
translation.ko: 내가 날 수 있도록 날개를 빌려줬어

translation.en: -[dramatic music playing] -Uh-huh.
Great things ahead. Grand adventures.
translation.ko: 멋진 미래가 있을 거야 커다란 모험

translation.en: Vast new horizons to explore.
I could use a good soldier at my side.
What do you say? Like the old days?
Well, if I’d known the occasional mediocre fuck in a hotel
translation.ko: 어쩌다 호텔에서 하는 그저 그런 섹스로

translation.en: made me a good soldier…
I know I’ve been out of touch for a long time and I’m sorry.
translation.ko: 오랫동안 연락 못 한 거 알아 미안해

translation.en: I understand how hard that must have been for you.
I was doing difficult and necessary work.
-I couldn’t risk contacting you. -[Gordon] No.
Of course not.
I warn you. Can’t be like it was before.
Going forward, we shall have to be rigorously discreet.
I may have to impart some lessons in tradecraft…
translation.ko: 스파이 기술이나 도청 탐지 같은 걸

translation.en: surveillance detection, so forth.
I have more now to lose than ever.
Not just Elsa. Lives all over the world could be jeopardized,
translation.ko: 엘사뿐만 아니라 전 세계 많은 사람이 위험할 수 있어

translation.en: should my reputation be compromised.
You know what?
-Better not risk it then. -Wait.
That old lady was right. You’re pathetic.
translation.ko: 그 할머니 말이 맞았어요 당신은 불쌍한 사람이에요

translation.en: -[Elsa] Where have you been? -Working.
Hmm. Oh, yes. With one of your friends.
translation.ko: 그래, 친구 중 한 명과 함께였겠지

translation.en: Shut up.
One of your disgusting sodomite friends.
Shut your fucking face.
Amanda was right. I should never have let you back here.
translation.ko: 어맨다가 옳았어 다시 돌아오지 못하게 해야 했어

translation.en: Amanda? You say her name to me tonight?
translation.ko: 어맨다? 오늘 밤, 나한테 그 이름을 얘기해?

translation.en: After I do her the common courtesy of inviting her here,
including her amongst the great and the powerful
translation.ko: 내 승리의 날에 위대하고 강력한 사람들 사이에 끼워줬는데

translation.en: on the evening of my triumph, and she has to storm out
translation.ko: 내 승리의 날에 위대하고 강력한 사람들 사이에 끼워줬는데 주요리가 나오기도 전에 삐쳐서 뛰쳐나갔지

translation.en: sulking before the main course,
like the silly, spoiled American little cunt she is--
Get out! Get out! I don’t want you here anymore.
translation.ko: 나가! 나가! 더는 여기에 있지 마

translation.en: -[Ulrich] Oh! -Get out! This is my house! I live here!
translation.ko: - 나가! - 내 집이야! 난 여기 살아

translation.en: They should have carted you off to the mausoleum years ago!
translation.ko: 수년 전에 당신을 무덤으로 싣고 가야 했어

translation.en: -You stay here… -Where do you belong?
translation.ko: - 아직 여기에 있는 건… - 넌 어디에 속하는데?

translation.en: …by the grace and charity of Ulrich Gero Mott,
translation.ko: 울리히 게로 모트의 품위와 자비 때문이야

translation.en: Count Albi, Brigadier General of the Republic of Iraq!
Brigadier General of fucking Iraq. [chuckles]
-What? -[Elsa chuckles]
The great brigadier general with a horseshoe up his ass!
Oh, sad. You need to denigrate me to sustain yourself.
Your great American rescue. [chuckles]
That was a coincidence, wasn’t it? What a piece of luck!
translation.ko: 그것도 우연이었어 그렇지? 얼마나 멋진 행운이야?

translation.en: You can’t stand what I’ve become.
translation.ko: 내가 성공하는 걸 못 견디는 거야

translation.en: I’ve grown so much greater than what you imagined,
translation.ko: 당신이 상상하는 것보다 훨씬 더 커졌어

translation.en: you can’t comprehend it.
You can’t stand that I don’t need you anymore.
translation.ko: 당신이 필요 없다는 걸 견딜 수 없는 거지

translation.en: -I’ve transcended you! -Oh, bravo!
You can’t stand that I’m not your fucking butler anymore!
translation.ko: 더는 집사가 아니라는 걸 참을 수 없겠지!

translation.en: Oh, I know you’re not my butler.
-You do, yeah? -You’re a fucking hotel clerk. [chuckles]
Yes, a hotel clerk in a crappy hotel.
-What? -[Elsa] Two years in a crappy motel
with TV and breakfast and a heated pool.
translation.ko: TV와 아침 식사 온수 수영장이 있는 곳

translation.en: Yes! I looked it all up. I have your tax statements.
translation.ko: 그래! 내가 다 찾아봤어 네 세금 신고서가 있거든

translation.en: All of your tax statements! [chuckles] All of them! You idiot!
translation.ko: 모든 세금 신고서가! 전부 다! 멍청한 놈!

translation.en: You gave them this home address as your permanent address.
translation.ko: 이 집 주소를 영구 주소로 줬잖아

translation.en: You poor idiot. Working for two years in a crappy motel.
-I don’t know what you’re talking about. -Sorry, the Villa Zarathustra.
translation.ko: 무슨 말인지 모르겠어 미안해, 빌라 자라투스트라

translation.en: Oh, the Mookie and the troops saluting. [chuckles]
You idiot! [chuckles]
You’re an idiot, do you hear? Idiot. Idiot! Fool!
[Ulrich] The men formed up and…
paid a kind of tribute to me.
He was telling me I belonged.
That my efforts here have not been wasted.
That I have made a difference after all.
